widgets.title: Resources/assets with full admin perms

queries.name: query1
queries.query:
find * with _class!='AccessPolicy' as asset 
(that (ASSIGNED|USES) AccessRole)? 
that ASSIGNED AccessPolicy that 
ALLOWS as rule Account 
where rule.permission='FULL_CONTROL'
return
count(asset) as value

widgets.title: Resources/assets with full admin perms

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find * with _class!='AccessPolicy' (that (ASSIGNED|USES) AccessRole)? that ASSIGNED AccessPolicy that ALLOWS as rule Account where rule.permission='FULL_CONTROL'

widgets.title: Nonpublic S3 buckets accessible via public EC2 instances

queries.name: query1
queries.query:
find Internet
  that allows >> aws_security_group
  that protects aws_instance with active=true
  that uses aws_iam_role that assigned AccessPolicy
  that allows (aws_s3|aws_s3_bucket) with public != true
return tree

widgets.title: Local accounts from inactive employees that still need to be de-provisioned

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find okta_user with active = false that is Person that is User with active = true as b return count(b), b._type

widgets.title: Public, production data stores not encrypted, grouped by type

queries.name: query1
queries.query:
find DataStore with encrypted != true and tag.Production = true and public = false as a 
  return a._type as name, count(a) as value

widgets.title: Are there cross-account VPC Peering connections?

queries.name: query1
queries.query:
Find aws_vpc as vpc1 that connects aws_vpc as vpc2
where vpc1.awsAccountId != vpc2.awsAccountId
return tree

widgets.title: Who has installed application  <X>

queries.name: query1
queries.query: FIND Person THAT OWNS Device THAT INSTALLED Application with _type ~= '{{ApplicationType}}'

widgets.description: Which PRs contained self-approved commits that were merged last week?
widgets.title: Which PRs contained self-approved commits that were merged last week?

queries.name: query1
queries.query: FIND PR WITH (approved = false OR allCommitsApproved = false) AND merged = true AND updatedOn > date.now - 7 days

widgets.title: Users without MFA

queries.name: query1
queries.query:
Find User with active = true and mfaEnabled != true
  that !(ASSIGNED|USES|HAS) mfa_device

widgets.title: Github Findings to review

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find github_finding as f that has github_repo as r (that has github_branch_protection_rule as b)? (that uses Secret as s)? that has github_pullrequest as pr that opened github_user as u return count(f) as ct, r.displayName order by ct desc

widgets.title: Assets with findings from multiple sources

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find Finding as a that has (CodeRepo|Host|HostAgent|Application|Project|Service|Alert) that has Finding as b where a._integrationType != b._integrationType

widgets.title: Public, production, critical data stores

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find DataStore with encrypted!=true and tag.Production=true and public=false and classification='critical'

widgets.title: Terminated Okta users that have lingering access

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find okta_user with active!=true that is Person that is User with active=true

widgets.title: AWS Cross-Account Assume Role Trusts Diagram

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find aws_account that has aws_iam that has aws_iam_role as a that (trusts|assigned) (Account|AccessRole|User|UserGroup) as b where a.tag.AccountName!=b.tag.AccountName return tree

widgets.title: EC2 instances accessible from the Internet via load balancer

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find aws_alb with public=true that has aws_vpc that contains aws_subnet with public=true as n that HAS aws_instance as i that PROTECTS aws_security_group as sg that ALLOWS as rule Internet return tree

widgets.title: Any resources with admin perms

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find * with _class!='AccessPolicy' that ASSIGNED AccessRole that ASSIGNED AccessPolicy that ALLOWS as rule Account where rule.permission='FULL_CONTROL'

widgets.title: Open findings by type

queries.name: query1
queries.query:
Find Finding with open!=false as f 
  return f._type as name, count(f) as value

widgets.description: Google users that aren't active but still have provisioned token access to apps
widgets.title: Google users that aren't active but still have provisioned token access to apps

queries.name: query1
queries.query: FIND google_user WITH active!=true OR archived!=false THAT ASSIGNED google_token THAT ALLOWS *

widgets.description: Google users with admin access token to Google Calendar or Drive
widgets.title: Google users with admin access token to Google Calendar or Drive

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find google_user as user THAT ASSIGNED google_token with scopes^=( "https://mail.google.com" OR "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail." OR "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive" OR "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ediscovery" OR "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin." ) return user.email, user.name, google_token.name, google_token.scopes

widgets.description: Top vendors with admin access to your Google Calendar
widgets.title: Top vendors with admin access to your Google Calendar

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find UNIQUE google_token WITH (scopes="https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar" and displayName != ("macOS" OR "iOS")) as t RETURN t.displayName as Vendor, count(t) as NumUsers

widgets.description: Top vendors with admin access to your Google Drive
widgets.title: Top vendors with admin access to your Google Drive

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find UNIQUE google_token WITH scopes="https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive" as t RETURN t.displayName as Vendor, count(t) as NumUsers

widgets.description: Top vendors with read access to your Google Drive
widgets.title: Top vendors with read access to your Google Drive

queries.name: query1
queries.query: Find UNIQUE google_token WITH scopes~=("drive" AND "readonly") as t RETURN t.displayName as Vendor, count(t) as NumUsers

widgets.description: Slack users without corporate email address
widgets.title: Slack users without corporate email address

queries.name: query1
queries.query: find slack_user with emailDomain !~= 'jupiterone.com' and active = true and bot != true
